intro: Allantodia jinpingensis, commonly known as the Jinping allantodia, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, hairy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
